es.title: Basic Greetings
es.description: Learn how to say hello, goodbye, and introduce yourself in Spanish

activities.question: What does "Hola" mean in English?
activities.explanation: Hola is the most common way to say hello in Spanish!

activities.question: How do you say "goodbye" in Spanish?
activities.explanation: Adiós is used to say goodbye.

activities.question: Translate to Spanish: "My name is..."
activities.explanation: "Me llamo" is how you introduce yourself in Spanish.

activities.question: Match the Spanish greetings to their English meanings:
activities.explanation: These are formal greetings used at different times of day.

es.title: Numbers 1-20
es.description: Master counting from 1 to 20 in Spanish

activities.question: What is the Spanish word for "three"?
activities.explanation: Tres means three in Spanish.

activities.question: Write the Spanish word for the number 5
activities.explanation: Cinco is the Spanish word for five.

activities.question: Which number comes after "nueve"?
activities.explanation: Nueve is nine, so diez (ten) comes next.

activities.question: Write the Spanish word for "ten"
activities.explanation: Diez is the Spanish word for ten.

activities.question: What is "uno" in English?
activities.explanation: Uno means one in Spanish.

es.title: Colors
es.description: Learn the names of common colors in Spanish

activities.question: What color is "rojo"?
activities.explanation: Rojo means red in Spanish.

activities.question: Write the Spanish word for "blue"
activities.explanation: Azul is the Spanish word for blue.

activities.question: Complete: "El cielo es ____" (The sky is blue)
activities.explanation: The sky is blue - El cielo es azul.

activities.question: Write the Spanish word for "green"
activities.explanation: Verde is green in Spanish.

activities.question: Match the colors:
activities.explanation: These are basic color words in Spanish.

es.title: Family Members
es.description: Vocabulary for talking about your family

activities.question: What does "madre" mean?
activities.explanation: Madre means mother in Spanish.

activities.question: Write the Spanish word for "brother"
activities.explanation: Hermano means brother in Spanish.

activities.question: Complete: "Tengo dos ____" (I have two brothers)
activities.explanation: Hermanos is the plural of hermano (brother).

activities.question: Match the family members:
activities.explanation: These are common family member terms in Spanish.

es.title: Days of the Week
es.description: Learn all seven days of the week

activities.question: What day is "lunes"?
activities.explanation: Lunes is Monday in Spanish.

activities.question: Write the Spanish word for "Friday"
activities.explanation: Viernes is Friday in Spanish.

activities.question: What does "¿Qué día es hoy?" mean?
activities.explanation: This phrase is used to ask what day it is today.

activities.question: Write the Spanish word for "Saturday"
activities.explanation: Sábado is Saturday in Spanish.

activities.question: Match the days:
activities.explanation: These are important days of the week.

activities.question: What is "agua"?
activities.explanation: Agua means water in Spanish.

activities.question: How do you say "bread" in Spanish?
activities.explanation: Pan is bread in Spanish.

activities.question: Match the foods:
activities.explanation: These are essential food vocabulary words.

activities.question: How do you say "I want water, please"?
activities.explanation: "Quiero" means "I want" and "por favor" means "please".

activities.question: What does "hablar" mean?
activities.explanation: Hablar is a regular -ar verb meaning "to speak".

activities.question: Conjugate "hablar" for "yo" (I)
activities.explanation: For -ar verbs, the yo form ends in -o: hablo.

activities.question: Which is correct: "I speak Spanish"?
activities.explanation: Yo (I) uses the -o ending: hablo.

activities.question: Match the verbs to their meanings:
activities.explanation: These are common regular verbs in Spanish.

es.title: Asking Questions
es.description: Learn how to ask common questions

activities.question: What does "¿Dónde?" mean?
activities.explanation: ¿Dónde? is used to ask "where?".

activities.question: How do you ask "What?" in Spanish?
activities.explanation: ¿Qué? means "What?" in Spanish.

activities.question: What does "¿Dónde está el baño?" mean?
activities.explanation: This is a very useful phrase for travelers!

activities.question: Match the question words:
activities.explanation: These are essential question words in Spanish.

es.title: Common Adjectives
es.description: Descriptive words for people and things

activities.question: What does "grande" mean?
activities.explanation: Grande means big or large in Spanish.

activities.question: What is the opposite of "grande"?
activities.explanation: Pequeño means small, the opposite of grande.

activities.question: Match the adjectives:
activities.explanation: These are common adjectives to describe quality.

activities.question: Complete: "La casa es ____" (The house is big)
activities.explanation: Grande is the correct adjective for "big".

activities.question: What does "¿Cuánto cuesta esto?" mean?
activities.explanation: This is the most common way to ask the price of something.

activities.question: Write the Spanish word for "store"
activities.explanation: Tienda means store or shop in Spanish.

activities.question: Match the shopping vocabulary:
activities.explanation: Essential vocabulary for shopping transactions.

activities.question: How do you say "It's very expensive"?
activities.explanation: Caro means expensive, barato means cheap.

activities.question: Translate: "I want to buy"
activities.explanation: Quiero comprar is used when you want to purchase something.
